correction_response:
This tweet is somewhat misleading. While it's true that Twitter has seen a drop in revenue and advertisers have been pressured by activist groups, it's not accurate to say "nothing has changed with content moderation". Twitter did shut off employee access to certain content moderation tools and eliminated its curation team, which could have contributed to the concerns of advertisers. Furthermore, the drop in advertisers began when Musk announced his intentions to buy the company, suggesting concerns about his approach to content moderation.
